questions.question_text: How is the region assigned to a device such as an IP phone?

choices.B: Regions can be assigned only through a device pool.
choices.A: Regions are assigned directly in the device configuration page.
choices.C: Regions can be assigned either directly on the device configuration page or through the device pool. If both configurations exist, the device pool region configuration takes precedence.
choices.D: Regions can be assigned either directly on the device configuration page or through the device pool. If both configurations exist, the device region configuration takes precedence. B

questions.question_text: Company X has a Cisco Unified Communications Manager cluster and a VCS Control server with video endpoints registered on both systems. Users find that video endpoints registered on Call manager can call each other and likewise for the endpoints registered on the VCS server. The administrator for Company X realizes he needs a SIP trunk between the two systems for any video endpoint to call any other video endpoint. Which two steps must the administrator take to add the SIP trunk? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Set up a SIP trunk on the VCS server with the destination address of the Cisco UCM and Transport set to TCP.
choices.E: Set up a traversal subzone on the VCS server to allow endpoints that are registered on Cisco UCM to communicate. AC
choices.A: Set up a SIP trunk on Cisco UCM with the option Device-Trunk with destination address of the VCS server.
choices.C: Set up a neighbor zone on the VCS server with the location of Cisco UCM using the menu option VCS Configuration > Zones > zone.
choices.B: Set up a subzone on Cisco UCM with the peer address to the VCS cluster.

discussion.content: Answer: C (note the status of transform is disabled, which means the dialed URI is NOT BEING transformed and is sent in its original form)

questions.question_text:
An engineer is troubleshooting a dial path etc" and it gives a config snapshot.
There are three fields populated with "CCNPCOLAB", "Add Suffix" and "@Cisco.com"
Mode : .....

Pattern type : Regex -

Pattern string : @cisco.com -
Pattern Behaviour :.......

Replace string : ccnpcollab -
Target : .....

State : Disabled -

discussion.content:
Finally, Correct answer is A.
The Use Hosted DN as PSTN Failover check box instructs Cisco Unified Communications Manager to create a ToDID rule of 0:. As a result, the number that is to be used for PSTN backup is identical to the internally used number.
I believe the answer is C not A

questions.question_text: Which statement is true regarding the configuration of SAF Forwarder?

choices.D: The destination IP address must match the loopback address of the SAF router.
choices.A: In a multisite dial plan, SAF Forwarders may exist in multiple autonomous systems.
choices.C: There should not be multiple nodes of Cisco Unified Communications Manager clusters acting as SAF clients.
choices.B: The client label that is configured in Cisco Unified Communications Manager must match the configuration on the SAF Forwarder router.
